column4: can anyone help ? After today's kernel header update, I can no longer boot into X. it says no NVIDIA module found !!!
You don't have the linux-restricted-modules package installed.  Boot back into a previous kernel (pressing "esc" at startup if necessary) and install the "linux-generic" package
ok I'll try but even the previous kernel doesn't boot into X
Really?  That might be a different problem then.
in deed I was using nvidia-glx-new. and after this thing happend I've uninstalled it and tried the binary nvidia driver within the new kernel. Could it be because of this
The nvidia.com driver is nothing but trouble.
In fact, the nvidia-glx-new package is the same driver as the (current stable) nvidia.com driver, just easier to install + upgrade.
The nvidia.com installer has an --uninstall command line switch, IIRC.
what was the linux component I was to install ?
linux-generic always depends on the most recent linux-image & linux-restricted-modules
thanks I am on the way
